headline: Fed leaning toward hawkish rate cut. What's to come in 2026?
summary: The Federal Reserve's December FOMC meeting will conclude on Wednesday, December 10, with US central bank officials voting on their last interest rate decision in 2025. Yahoo Finance senior Fed reporter Jennifer Schonberger and Siebert Financial CIO Mark Malek discuss how investors are expecting a hawkish rate cut by Fed officials at this meeting, Fed Chair Jerome Powell's comments on the labor market, and Fed staffing concerns. Also check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Also check out Jennifer Schonberger's profiles on the five shortlist candidates that President Trump could nominate as the next Fed chair after Powell's term ends in May 2026: frontrunner Kevin Hassett, former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, current Fed Governor Chris Waller, Fed Vice Chair of Supervision Michelle Bowman, and BlackRock's (BLK) head of fixed income Rick Rieder. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: BHP Spurs Infrastructure Selloff as Miners Adjust Spending Plans
summary: The mining giant will sell almost half of its 85% interest in the power network to BlackRock Inc.’s Global Infrastructure Partners LP and pay a tariff linked to its stake over a 25-year period, BHP said in a statement Tuesday.  BHP first flagged its intention to sell interests in infrastructure in August, saying it would recycle capital into higher-return growth opportunities, a sentiment echoed last week by its biggest rival, Rio Tinto Group.
